title: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText beeps when I choose SWT.MULTI
description: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText beeps when I choose SWT.MULTI. Somehow, I don't think it's supposed to do that.
OB: When using the SWT example ControlExample, under the Text tab, when I click on Styles SWT.MULTI, the ControlExampleText beeps. Additionally, clicking on other buttons also produces the bell sound.
EB: When using the SWT example ControlExample, under the Text tab, when I click on Styles SWT.MULTI, the ControlExampleText should not produce any sound.
SR:
1. Open the SWT example ControlExample. 
2. Go to the Text tab. 
3. Click on Styles SWT.SINGLE. 
4. Click on Styles SWT.MULTI. 
5. Observe if the ControlExampleText produces a beep sound. 
6. Additionally, try clicking on other buttons to check if they also produce the bell sound.
